articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Industrial Establishments in Hamhung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Industrial Establishments in Hamhung
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to industrial establishments in Hamhung making a leap forward.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex.
					
					 He looked round the construction site of the gasification process to learn in detail about the progress made in the project. 
					
					 There sprang up in the land of Hungnam another great structure, a great product of self-reliance, and it has become possible to greet the hour when the hurrah of victory will be shouted thanks to the devoted efforts of the workers of the complex, the Ryongsong Machine Complex, the Equipment Assembling Complex, the Tanchon Mining and Construction Complex and the Hamhung Industrial Construction Office and other builders and helpers. 
					
					 He highly appreciated the feats performed by them and extended thanks to them.
					
					 It is another miracle to be specially recorded in the history of construction that the herculean and huge project has been wound up in the main in a matter of one and half years, he said, adding that this is a new Chollima speed, the speed of the DPRK which takes a thousand steps while others do just ten steps.
					
					 He said that the completion of the gasification process at the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex would help consolidate the Juche-oriented production system of fertilizers based on locally available raw materials and bring about a decisive turn in solving the food shortage.
					
					 He set forth tasks to be fulfilled by the complex to commission the gasification process ahead of schedule.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and conviction that the workers of Hungnam would bring about a fresh turn in the production of fertilizers and thus positively contribute to agricultural development of the country. 
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Hungnam Smeltery.
					
					 He went round different production processes including the hard alloy shop to learn in detail about the technological updating and production there.
					
					 He noted with satisfaction that the perfection of a modern hard alloy tool production system having all processes ranging from raw material feeding to finishing process helped home-made CNC-based equipment on the world's level pay off more profusely. 
					
					 He acquainted himself in detail with the use of cultural and welfare facilities and the supply service for the workers.
					
					 He had a photo session with labor innovators. 
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Hamhung Woolen Mill. 
					
					 Looking round the room devoted to the history of the mill, he said that the mill which has turned into a large-scale textile producer thanks to the wise leadership and meticulous care of President Kim Il Sung has played a great role in solving the issue of clothing in the past. He highly appreciated the successes made by the workers of the mill. 
					
					 After being briefed on the mill before a huge map showing its panoramic view, he went round different places to acquaint himself in detail with technical equipment and production. 
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the workers of the mill would boost the production and supply of quality clothing materials to contribute to improving the standard of people's living and accomplishing the cause of building a thriving nation. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam and Hong Sok Hyong,  members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: National Meeting of Active Women's Union Members for Songun Culture Held
articles.content:
National Meeting of Active Women's Union Members for Songun Culture Held
						
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of active women's union members for Songun culture was held here on Thursday. 
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Ha Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, officials concerned and exemplary officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea.
					
					 A report of Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the union, was followed by speeches. 
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that President Kim Il Sung set it as an important task of the women's union to establish cultured practice in life and led them with warm care so that they might creditably perform their moral duties and responsibilities before families and society. 
					
					 Noting that the shining history of the Korean women's movement is recorded with the immortal exploits of indomitable revolutionary fighter Kang Pan Sok and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, they went on:
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il indicated tasks and ways for establishing Songun culture throughout the society in his many works and has wisely led the drive to implement them.
					
					 Referring to the great achievements made in the drive of the organizations and members of the union to establish cultured practice in life in the era of Songun, they underscored the need for all officials and members of the union to fulfill their duties in the efforts to glorify Songun Korea as a highly civilized power. 
					
					 An appeal to the members of the union and women across the country was adopted there. 
					
					 It called upon all of them to always live a worthwhile life, keeping pace with the footsteps of Kim Jong Il making ceaseless forced march of highest intensity to translate the desire of the President to build a rich and powerful nation into reality.

articles.title: AP CEO and His Party Visit Several Places of Pyongyang
articles.content:
AP CEO and His Party Visit Several Places of Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Thomas Curley, president and chief executive officer of the Associated Press of the United States, and his party visited the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					 The guests looked round the tower and group of sculptures there, being briefed on the tower conveying to posterity the great ideological and theoretical exploits of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They went to the observation deck of the tower from where they commanded a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang.
					
					 They visited the Grand People's Study House and went round various reading rooms and lecture rooms.
					
					 They also enjoyed a performance given by the State Symphony Orchestra after visiting the Arch of Triumph, the Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition, the Changgwang Kindergarten, the Pyongyang Metro, the Taedonggang Beer Factory, etc.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Personage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Personage
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Pavel Ovsyannikov, head and chief conductor of the "Orchestra of the 21st Century" of Russia, was interviewed by KCNA at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Wednesday.
					He referred to the fact that artistes of the DPRK and Russia put on the stage a joint performance in the presence of General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the International Women's Day.
					
					 He went on: 
					
					 Kim Jong Il spared time to watch the joint performance given by the Russian orchestra and the Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe though he was very busy. 
					
					 I was deeply impressed by his profound knowledge of music. 
					
					 During our stay here we learned through media that he enjoyed a performance by the State Symphony Orchestra. 
					
					 He ushered in a great heyday of symphony. 
					
					 The artistes of the Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe who staged the performance together with us were very high in the level of their representation and artistic skills. 
					
					 While giving the joint performance, we could deeply feel that arts are making steady progress in the DPRK. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il is a great genius of arts.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Effort to Improving Tourism Infrastructure
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Effort to Improving Tourism Infrastructure
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Good results have been made in improving the infrastructure of tourism in the DPRK in recent years, said a department director of the State General Bureau of Tourism.
					 Speaking to KCNA, Hong In Chol said the Central Zoo and Kaeson Youth Park in Pyongyang, Majon Hotel on the east coast, Hyangsan Hotel, Folk Street of Sariwon City and paths leading to the top of Mt. Myohyang in the western part of the country have been constructed or reconstructed.
					
					 The DPRK government took measures to facelift hotels and public catering establishments like Hyangsan Hotel and Okryu Restaurant and draw more tourists.
					
					 A folklore park is under construction at the foot of Mt. Taesong in Pyongyang to show the time-honored history and brilliant culture of the Korean nation.
					
					 Tourist and service facilities have been constructed in Rason, Kaesong and Lake Sijung and other areas.

articles.title: N. Hwanghae Committee-Vietnam Friendship Association Inaugurated
articles.content:
N. Hwanghae Committee-Vietnam Friendship Association Inaugurated
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association was inaugurated with due ceremony in Sariwon on Thursday. 
					 Attending the ceremony were Jo Tong Chol, vice-chairman of the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee, Pak Kyong Il, vice-chairman of the association, and other officials, Ambassador Le Van Cu and staff members of the Vietnamese embassy here.
					
					 The chairman, vice-chairman and members of the North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association were elected at the ceremony.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, the participants enjoyed a performance given by the artistes of the North Hwanghae Provincial Art Troupe.

articles.title: Socialist Emulation in Agricultural Sector
articles.content:
Socialist Emulation in Agricultural Sector
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A socialist emulation has been launched in the DPRK to increase grain production this year.
					 The Pyongyang City has encouraged members of the Union of Agricultural Working People (UAWP) to give full play to their spiritual power in farming preparations. 
					
					 UAWP organizations in North Phyongan Province have focused on solving problems arising in getting ready for farming.
					
					 Exhibitions of farming tools have been held two times in all the cities and counties of North Hwanghae Province.
					
					 Such display has also been held in Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province, drawing more than 12,000 pieces of 60 kinds.

articles.title: New Monitoring and Control System
articles.content:
New Monitoring and Control System 
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A new comprehensive monitoring and control system has been introduced in the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory, Tanchon Smeltery and many other industrial establishments of the DPRK.
					 The system has such functions as image and sound monitoring and recording, multipath searching and fire detection. 
					
					 It is also linked with networks for reading.
					
					 The new system has proved effective in improving the quality of products and management of factories.

articles.title: Korean Stamps Enjoy Popularity
articles.content:
Korean Stamps Enjoy Popularity 
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Sixty-five years has elapsed since the first stamp was issued in the DPRK after the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					The first stamp "Samsonam" was brought out on March 12, Juche 35 (1946) to be followed by many stamps. They show revolutionary activities and noble traits of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu -- President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk -- and reflect achievements made by the Korean people in political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields of social life.
					
					 Korean stamps are seen in more than 100 countries.
					
					 The State Stamp Bureau issues stamps of diverse themes.
					
					 Stamps, postcards and calendars published by the bureau are popular among foreigners and overseas Koreans, too.
					
					 Some of the stamps won top prizes at world-famous stamp expositions.

articles.title: Oil Painting "View of Old Belgrade"
articles.content:
Oil Painting "View of Old Belgrade"
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- An art troupe of defunct Yugoslavia presented an oil painting "View of Old Belgrade" to President Kim Il Sung when it took part in the April Spring Friendship Art Festival in Juche 74 (1985). The gift is now on display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK.
					 The gift is a token of its deep reverence for the President.
					
					 The art troupe purchased the painting from an art gallery in Belgrade.
					
					 The oil painting won the top prize at a national art exhibition of Yugoslavia held in 1983.

articles.title: Stone Astronomical Chart of Koguryo
articles.content:
Stone Astronomical Chart of Koguryo
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- An astronomical chart carved on a stone dating back to the period of Koguryo (BC 277 to AD 668) is a precious heritage showing the time-honored history and brilliant culture of the Korean nation.
					 Koguryo people observed solar eclipse, lunar eclipse, and planet and comet motions and recorded them on a stone.
					
					 The chart provided assistance to getting the astronomical theory and knowledge and data necessary for astronomical observation and to making calendar.
					
					 According to "Haedong Miscellany", a book of the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910), the chart was kept in the walled city of Pyongyang but it was lost in the closing years of Koguryo when foreign aggressors attacked the country.
					
					 It, reproduced on paper in facsimile, was discovered in the early period of the Ri Dynasty.
					
					 On the basis of the astronomical chart, a new one was made in 1395. It is known as Chonsangryolchabunyajido.
					
					 It reflects the celestial sphere with the North Pole in the center. Carved on the flat stone were 1 467 stars in 282 constellations, positions of vernal and autumnal equinoxes and the Galaxy.

articles.title: Japan's Abduction Crime of Long Standing
articles.content:
Japan's Abduction Crime of Long Standing
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Japan's abduction and massacre of Korean people have been recorded from the middle ages.
					According to the old book "Koryosa" (History of Koryo), Japanese gangsters intruded into Hamju, Hongwon, Pukchong and other areas between 1375 and early 1388 to kill and abduct local people. They kidnapped more than 1,000 people a day from Kanghwa Island.
					
					 Another old book "Sejong Sillok" (Chronicles of King Sejong) says that the Japanese intrusion became frequent in the closing years of Koryo, setting fire to towns, killing people and robbing their properties.
					
					 During the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598), Japanese troops took a lot of ceramic pieces and ceramists away from Korea.
					
					 Tailors, technicians, doctors, scholars, women and even children were victims of their abduction.
					
					 According to an understated figure released by Japan, the number of Korean abductees exceeds 100 000 in the period of the Imjin war.
					
					 Some of them were sold to Europe as slaves.
					
					 There were slave markets in Nagasaki, Hirado and Hakata ports.
					
					 The graves of Korean women in Shikoku, Tokushima and Kochi, old workplaces and graves of Korean ceramists in different parts of Japan and Korean towns built by them serve as a reminder of Japan's crimes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Removal of Cold War Structure from Northeast Asia
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Removal of Cold War Structure from Northeast Asia
						
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. new "National Military Strategy" pursues a criminal aim to accelerate the formation of a triangular military alliance involving the U.S., Japan and south Korea in Northeast Asia and preserve and consolidate the Cold War structure. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a by-lined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Northeast Asia used to be a theatre of acute showdown between socialism and imperialism in the Cold War era and this outdated structure of the Cold War still exists there. 
					
					 The main objective of the U.S. strategy toward the region is to prevent other powers from increasing their influence in the region by force and establish a U.S.-dominated hegemonic order there. 
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that it is opting for reorganizing its overall armed forces in conformity with its new regional strategy, the strategy of giving importance to the region, while persistently preserving and consolidating the Cold War structure in the region. 
					
					 In order to ensure peace and security in Northeast Asia it is a priority task to completely eliminate the leftover of the Cold War from this region. To this end, it is necessary to dismantle all foreign military bases in this region and force the troops to pull out of it. 
					
					 There is no justification for the U.S. to keep its aggression forces and military bases in the region. 
					
					 The fabrication of a new military bloc for aggression diametrically runs counter to the trend of the present times. 
					
					 The moves to knock into shape the above-said military alliance are grave criminal acts as they are aimed to disturb peace in the region and spark a war. 
					
					 The formation of a new military bloc in the region by the U.S. would be the root cause of seriously threatening peace and stability in the region and sparking a war. 
					
					 It is a key link in the chain efforts to ensure peace in the region to avert a war and preserve peace on the Korean Peninsula. The increasing danger of military conflict on the peninsula fraught with the tensest situation and greatest danger of the war in the world is bound to further strain the situation in the region. 
					
					The United States should make a bold decision to fulfil its responsibility for eradicating the leftover of the Cold War era in the region.

articles.title: DPRK-Targeted War Exercises Go on in S. Korea
articles.content:
DPRK-Targeted War Exercises Go on in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist warlike forces let Striker, a rapid task force, stage on March 7 a live-ammunition drill in Kyonggi Province while madcap Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises were under way throughout south Korea. 
					 They opened to media the drill of Striker armed with ultra-modern war equipment, fanning up war hysteria. 
					
					 On March 8 they frantically staged war exercises for getting familiar with the rapid deployment of U.S. reinforcements and other operations in Taegu.
					
					 A similar war drill was staged in Pusan on the same day where there is the operation command of the south Korean puppet navy.
					
					 In another development, the puppet fire fighting and disaster prevention agency announced on March 15 that it would stage a large-scale "civil defense training."
					
					 It was reported that armored cars and other war equipment of the puppet army would be involved in the drill for the first time.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Remark Prompted by Sinister Intention
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Remark Prompted by Sinister Intention
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive in his address on March 1 called for joining hands with Japan, not taking issue with its past crime.
					 His pro-Japanese remark was apparently prompted by a sinister intention to hurt the fellow countrymen in the north with the help of Japan.
					
					 In fact, south Korea and Japan are seeking military tie-up. Some time ago, the south Korean authorities discussed cooperating with Japan in the munitions industry and information gathering allegedly to cope with the north's "provocations".
					
					 The south Korean attempt for military cooperation with Japan has caused a anti-Japanese protest of south Korean people. In this context, the south Korean chief executive takes every chance to ease anti-Japanese public feelings and underscore the need to form a military alliance with Japan.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Accused of Stoking Social Discord and Division
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Accused of Stoking Social Discord and Division
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore carried an editorial on Mar. 5 accusing the chief executive of stoking discord and division in the south Korean society.
					 It referred to the fact that a photo of Lee Myung Bak and his wife praying together with their knees bent at a recent breakfast prayer meeting was made public, adding that this turned out to be an evil deed of stoking division and discord rather than making the people cooperate in harmony.
					
					 The Buddhist circle unanimously stood against it and Kaesin's excessive political meddling is causing uproar, it said, and went on:
					
					 Under the present "government" contradiction and discord among religious groups have reached a dangerous phase because the "president" appointed those guys having acquaintanceship with the Somang Religious Circle to important posts of Chongwadae and the Cabinet and those close to the "president" let loose a whole string of biased religious remarks, etc.
					
					 This notwithstanding, the "president" has persistently hung on the smiles of Kaesin, his political support base, far from coming out with a positive reconciliation measure.
					
					 The recent case is a product of Lee Myung Bak's pro-Kaesin acts.
					
					 It is the people before whom the "president" should bend his knees and sincerely beg. Aren't they?

articles.title: S. Korean Inhabitants Uneasy about Scattering of Leaflets against North
articles.content:
S. Korean Inhabitants Uneasy about Scattering of Leaflets against North 
						
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Inhabitants in the area along the Military Demarcation Line are seized with uneasiness, according to an editorial of Kyunghyang Daily News, the south Korean newspaper on Mar. 8.
					 The editorial recalled that a few days ago, residents in Munsan in Phaju City, Kyonggi Province, urged a conservative organization to stop scattering leaflets against the north in the area of the Rimjin Pavilion, declaring they would physically block it at any cost.
					
					 There is no measure to dispel the uneasiness though the residents are living, exposed to the constant danger of military clash between the north and the south, the editorial deplored.

articles.title: Actions for Implementing 6.15 Joint Declaration Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Implementing 6.15 Joint Declaration Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Academic Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration held a regular meeting in Seoul on March 5 to define its goals for carrying it out this year.
					 The organization declared at the meeting that it would give spurs to explaining the validity and vitality of the joint declaration on the basis of achievements and experience gained in the past and intensifying the academic activities to encourage people from all walks of life in their drive to implement the declaration. 
					
					 To this end, the organization decided to form the June 15 academic forum and hold regular academic seminars and joint seminar of Koreans in the south and north and abroad to commemorate the anniversaries of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. 
					
					 It said that it would expand the organization and stage widespread actions in solidarity with the headquarters under the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration.

articles.title: Japanese Personages Calls for Solution to Issue of Support for Korean Schools
articles.content:
Japanese Personages Calls for Solution to Issue of Support for Korean Schools
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Japanese personages visited Tokyo Korean Middle and High School on March 4 to support its students in their actions to seek a solution to the issue of supporting the Korean schools. 
					 They included President Masuo Motohashi, Secretary General Hisashi Seki and former President Sinichi Hongo of the Tokyo Peace Movement Center of Japan, Deputy Secretary General Kenji Mizudani of the Tokyo-Pyongyang Friendship Interchange Council.
					
					 The Japanese government's denial of the right to learning of the Korean students, the right all students are entitled to have, is a grave human right abuse, they said, calling for struggling in unity till the tuition-waiver program is applied to them.
					
					 It is painful to note that the issue of the above-said program remains unsettled before the graduation of the students, they deplored, holding that such inequality should be terminated without fail.

articles.title: Japan Intensifies Discrimination against Korean Schools
articles.content:
Japan Intensifies Discrimination against Korean Schools in Japan
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The governor of Osaka Prefecture, Japan, on Tuesday said the prefecture would not pay money in aid to Osaka Korean High School for 2010.
					 He expressed this stand, claiming that there were not satisfactory answers from the school to the questionnaire as regards the conditions for the payment of aid fund including the reexamination of the contents of textbooks. 
					
					 Unfair discriminations against Korean schools are becoming undisguised among the Japanese local self-governing organizations at a time when the Japanese government is conducting a campaign against the DPRK and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan without retracting the measures to suspend the procedures for the institutional application of the tuition-waiver program to Korean schools.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Korean Victims Held in Tokyo
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Korean Victims Held in Tokyo
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for Korean victims was held in Tokyo on March 5, 66 years since U.S. forces' air raid on Tokyo. 
					 Present there were Pak Ku Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), Jin Kil Sang, vice-chairman of the Rights and Welfare Committee of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, and other officials of Chongryon and compatriots, students of Tokyo Korean Middle and High School and Japanese personages. 
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the victims. 
					
					 Speeches were made by a member of the Tokyo Metropolitan Assembly, a member of Nakano District, Tokyo Metropolis, Assembly, a Christian pastor and a representative of the Society for Remembering the Korean Victims of the Air Raid on Tokyo.
					
					 Introduced at the memorial service were letters sent by Mizuho Fukushima, head of the Social-Democratic Party of Japan, and Akihiro Hatsushiga, member of the House of Representatives from the Japan Democratic Party. 
					
					 The service heard a memorial address sent by the Committee on Measures for Compensation to Former Korean "Comfort Women" for Japanese Army and Drafting Victims and the Committee for Investigation into Victims of Forced Drafting during Anti-Japanese Resistance, the Committee for Supporting Victims of Forced Drafting Abroad and other support committees.

articles.title: Mexican Party Leader on Boosting Friendly Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Mexican Party Leader on Boosting Friendly Relations with WPK
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the National Executive Committee of the National Action Party of Mexico expressed his will to make positive efforts to boost the friendly relations with the Workers' Party of Korea in the future.
					 He said this when meeting with DPRK ambassador to Mexico An Kun Song on March 2.
					
					 He wished the WPK and the Korean people great successes in the drive to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Cambodian Paper on DPRK's Building of a Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Cambodian Paper on DPRK's Building of a Thriving Nation
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The March 2 issue of the Cambodian paper Pracheachon (The People) carried an article on the DPRK's building of a thriving nation with photos on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's activities.
					 The article said that 2010 was a year of drastic changes for the Korean people in which eye-opening events took place one after another to bring the future of prosperity.
					
					 The DPRK set it as the most important task to put the people's standard of living on the level befitting a thriving nation this year and, to this end, it is giving priority to the development of the light industry while channeling efforts into it, it noted, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il has wisely led the Korean people in the drive to effect a great surge in the efforts to improve the people's standard of living and build an economic power.
					
					 "Bring about a Decisive Turn in the Improvement of the People's Standard of Living and the Building of a Great, Prosperous and Powerful Country by Accelerating the Development of Light Industry Once Again This Year" is the slogan the Korean people put up this year.

articles.title: Global Support for DPRK's Stand Called for in Mexico
articles.content:
Global Support for DPRK's Stand Called for in Mexico
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Political parties and institutions in Mexico issued a joint statement on March 5 in denunciation of the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers' Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers.
					 They included the People's Socialist Party, Socialist Popular Party, Socialist Party, Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, Fellowship Institute to Honor the Memory of President Kim Il Sung, Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association. 
					
					 The military drills disclosed once again before the world that the U.S. remains unchanged in its hostile policy to block the peaceful development of the DPRK by various means and stifle its socialist system by force, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 They fully support the DPRK's stand that it is ready for both dialogue and confrontation and it will deal a decisive and merciless blow at those who are keen to violate its sovereignty and dignity.
					
					 The U.S. should behave with discretion, bearing in mind that it would be held fully accountable for all the consequences to be entailed by its military provocations.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet warmongers should stop at once the reckless military maneuvers.
					
					 The statement called on all the political parties, governments, organizations, progressives and international organizations in the world desirous of the peace on the Korean Peninsula and other regions to denounce the U.S.-south Korea joint military maneuvers and support the stand of the army and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: UN Chief Calls for Israel's Release of Palestinian Prisoners
articles.content:
UN Chief Calls for Israel's Release of Palestinian Prisoners
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The UN secretary-general in a message to an international meeting on Monday called for the release of thousands of Palestinian political prisoners detained by Israel, saying the release is conducive to the efforts to seek a just and lasting peace between the Israelis and the Palestinians.

articles.title: India Seeks to Resolve All Outstanding Issues with Pakistan via Dialogue
articles.content:
India Seeks to Resolve All Outstanding Issues with Pakistan via Dialogue
 New Delhi, March 8 (KCNA) -- The Indian Prime Minister on March 4 referred to issue of relations with Pakistan.
					"We wish to resolve all outstanding issues between the two countries through friendly dialogues and purposeful negotiations. And this includes the issue of Jammu and Kashmir," Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh said.

articles.title: Venezuela Rejects New OAS Secretary General's Statements
articles.content:
Venezuela Rejects New OAS Secretary General's Statements
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan ambassador to the Organization of American States (OAS), Roy Chaderton, accused on Saturday the general secretary of that organization, Jose Miguel Insulza, of exaggerating, lying and distorting the reality of his country.
					 Chaderton told reporters that Insulza has an anti-Venezuelan agenda in reference to his recent statements that 2012 will be a year filled with tension in Venezuela due to the presidential election.
					
					 According to Chaderton, Insulza is playing the role of ventriloquist's dummy because he takes the words of the spokesmen of the imperial dictatorship.

articles.title: Russia Modernizes Military Equipment
articles.content:
Russia Modernizes Military Equipment
 Moscow, March 10 (KCNA) -- Russia has directed a great effort to bolstering up its defense capabilities through modernization of military equipment.
					 It has taken substantial measures for this purpose in line with the modernization program.
					
					 Some time ago, the first deputy minister of Defense made public the program for military modernization by 2020. According to the program, Russia will spend 19 trillion Rbl to upgrade strategic nuclear forces, and naval and air force equipment.
					
					 Russia plans to put a latest-type submarine-launched ballistic missile "Bulava" in commission within the year to cope with the U.S. missile defense system.
					
					 It also plans to build eight nuclear submarines of next generation capable of loading "Bulava" and equip the army with some 600 new aircrafts and 1,000 helicopters till 2020.
					
					 Four Mistral-class helicopter carriers will be deployed in the Far East waters.
					
					 Russia also plans to manufacture a new ground-launched inter-continental ballistic missile based on liquid fuel till 2018.

articles.title: Romanian President on Struggle against Tax
articles.content:
Romanian President on Struggle against Tax
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Romania must continue to fight the crime ruthlessly, President Traian Basescu said Monday at a meeting.
					 More than 30 percent of the tax resources are lost because of tax evasion, said Basescu.
					
					 He stressed that nothing weakens a state more than the diminished financial resources.
					
					 He said that all state institutions have to concentrate their efforts on fighting the crime.
					
					 "The battle for curbing tax evasion continues to be a major priority," the president said.

articles.title: Indonesia's Steps for Corruption Eradication
articles.content:
Indonesia's Steps for Corruption Eradication
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Indonesia is channeling efforts into the drive to eradicate corruption.
					The Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin) recently signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) on corruption eradication in the business world, with the Attorney General's Office (AGO) and the National Police.
					
					The MOU would help the three parties to work together to tackle these problems.

articles.title: Myanmar Plans Development of New Capital
articles.content:
Myanmar Plans Development of New Capital 
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Myanmar is directing efforts to developing the new capital and boosting tourism.
					 Myanmar has started building an advanced stadium, Zeyathiri, in Nay Pyi Taw, with the cornerstone laid in February this year.
					
					 It has laid down a plan for expanding the building of high-rise hotels, shopping complexes, etc.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige fabrica y empresas de Hamhung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige fabrica y empresas de Hamhung
 Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio en el terreno fabrica y empresas de la ciudad de Hamhung que producen un auge.
					  El estuvo primero en el Complejo de Abonos de Hungnam.
					
					  Averiguo en detalles como marcha la obra del proceso de gasificacion recorriendo el campo de construccion.
					
					  Gracias a la lucha abnegada de los obreros del Complejo de Abonos de Hungnam, el Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong, el Complejo de Montaje de Equipos, el Complejo de Construccion Minera de Tanchon y la Empresa de Construccion Industrial de Hamhung, y otros constructores y voluntarios, se construyo en Hungnam otra gran creacion de autoconfianza que deja prever la inminente victoria, destaco el Dirigente y evaluo los meritos de ellos expresandoles agradecimiento.
					
					  Apunto que la terminacion en lo principal de esa obra dificil y enorme en un ano y medio es otro milagro que se registrara en la historia de construccion.
					
					  Prosiguio que esto se llama la nueva velocidad de Chollima y la de Corea para dar cien y mil pasos por cada uno y diez que den los otros.
					
					  Diciendo que la conclusion del proceso de gasificacion del Complejo de Abonos de Hungnam permitira establecer firmemente el autoctono sistema de produccion de abonos con materias primas nacionales y registrar cambios decisivos en la solucion del problema de alimentos, presento las tareas para inaugurarlo con anticipacion.
					
					  Expreso gran esperanza y conviccion de que la clase obrera de Hungnam contribuira mucho al desarrollo agricola del pais al propiciar un nuevo viraje en la produccion de abonos.
					
					  Acto seguido, dirigio la Fundicion de Metales No Ferrosos de Hungnam.
					
					  Se informo en detalles del estado de reconstruccion tecnica y de produccion recorriendo varios procesos productivos como el taller de aleacion dura.
					
					  Expreso su satisfaccion diciendo que al establecerse el proceso de produccion de herramientas de aleacion dura, modernizado desde la entrada de materias primas hasta el proceso final, funcionaran mas efectivamente los equipos nacionales CNC de nivel mundial.
					
					  Inquirio como los obreros usan las facilidades culturales y de servicio publico y como marcha el abastecimiento a ellos.
					
					  A continuacion, se fotografio junto con los innovadores laborales.
					
					Por ultimo, visito la Fabrica Textil de Lana de Hamhung.
					
					Tras recorrer la sala de presentacion del historial, el Dirigente dijo que la fabrica fue convertida en una gran base de produccion de telas bajo la sabia direccion y minuciosa atencion del Presidente     Kim Il Sung y jugo anteriormente un papel importante en solucionar el problema de vestidos del pueblo y evaluo altamente los exitos de trabajo logrados por los empleados de ella.
					
					Despues de escuchar explicaciones ante el plano de de la fabrica, el Dirigente se informo detalladamente del estado de equipos tecnicos y de produccion recorriendo varios lugares.
					
					Manifesto su esperanza y conviccion de que la clase obrera de la fabrica contribuira activamente al mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y al cumplimiento de la causa de construccion de la gran potencia prospera al producir y suministrar mucho mas telas de buena calidad.
					
					En esta ocasion, el Dirigente fue acompanado por Kim Ki Nam y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, y Kwak Pom Gi, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.

articles.title: Thomas Curley y su comitiva visitan varios lugares
articles.content:
Thomas Curley y su comitiva visitan varios lugares
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- El presidente de la agencia norteamericana AP, Thomas Curley, y su comitiva visitaron el Monumento a la Idea Juche. 
					  Los huespedes recorrieron la torre y las esculturas escuchando explicaciones sobre el monumento que transmite las grandes hazanas ideo-teoricas del Presidente Kim Il Sung. 
					
					  Desde el observador en la cima de la torre, contemplaron el paisaje de la ciudad de Pyongyang. 
					
					  Luego, visitaron el Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo recorriendo las salas de lectura y de leccion.
					
					  Estuvieron ademas en el Arco de Triunfo, la Exposicion Permanente de Cultura de Pyongyang, el Jardin de la Infancia de Changgwang, el metro de Pyongyang, la Fabrica de Cerveza Taedonggang, etc., y presenciaron la funcion de la Orquesta Sinfonica Nacional.

articles.title: Tiene lugar reunion nacional de UMDC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar reunion nacional de UMDC
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 10 en esta capital la Reunion Nacional de Activistas de la Cultura del Songun de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea.
					Participaron el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Nam, el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, Jon Ha Chol, y otros funcionarios, las funcionarias y miembros ejemplares de la UMDC. 
					
					El informe de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de la presidenta del CC de la UMDC, Ro Song Sil, y hubo discursos. 
					
					Los oradores recordaron que el Presidente            Kim Il Sung presento el establecimiento de la cultura de vida como una de las importantes tareas de la UMDC y condujo a las mujeres para que cumplieran satisfactoriamente con su deber moral y responsabilidad asumidos ante la familia y la sociedad. 
					
					En los anales de la orgullosa historia del movimiento femenino de Corea estan registradas las imborrables proezas de la indoblegable combatiente revolucionaria Kang Pan Sok y de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, destacaron. 
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il indico en varias obras las tareas y remedios para establecer la cultura del Songun en toda la sociedad y dirigio sabiamente la lucha por cumplirlas, enfatizaron. 
					
					Se refirieron a los grandes exitos alcanzados en los trabajos de las organizaciones de la UMDC y las mujeres para establecer la cultura de vida de la epoca del Songun y agregaron que todas las funcionarias y miembros de la UMDC deben cumplir con su mision en la lucha por convertir a la Corea del Songun en la potencia civilizada. 
					
					En el acto fue aprobado el llamamiento a las mujeres y miembros de la UMDC de todo el pais.
					
					El documento exhorta a vivir con gran entusiasmo marcando los pasos con el Dirigente quien emprende incansablemente la guia en el terreno a manera de marcha forzada para realizar el deseo del Presidente de construir una patria prospera.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il es genio de arte, elogia artista ruso
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il es genio de arte, elogia artista ruso 
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- El jefe y director principal de la Orquesta del Siglo 21 de Rusia, Pavel Ovsyannikov, concedio el dia 9 una entrevista con la ATCC en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang.
					Aunque esta muy ocupado, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il presencio la funcion conjunta de nuestra orquesta y la Banda Samjiyon del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae dedicada al Dia Internacional de la Mujer, comenzo Pavel y continuo:
					
					Me han impresionado mucho los conocimientos tan profundos del Dirigente sobre la musica.
					
					Durante nuestra estancia aqui, leimos las publicaciones que informaban la funcion de la Orquesta Sinfonica Nacional de Corea ofrecida bajo la presencia del camarada Kim Jong Il. 
					
					El abrio la era de prosperidad de la sinfonia. 
					
					Por anadidura, son muy talentosos los artistas de la Banda Samjiyon del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae que actuaron con nosotros.
					
					A traves de la funcion conjunta, pudimos sentir el desarrollo constante del arte coreano.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il es el genio de arte.

articles.title: Constituido comite provincial de Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Vietnam
articles.content:
Constituido comite provincial de Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Vietnam
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 10 en Sariwon la ceremonia de constitucion del Comite de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Vietnam.
					Estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Comite Popular de la citada provincia, Jo Tong Chol, el vicepresidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Vietnam, Pak Kyong Il, y otros funcionarios coreanos, el embajador vietnamita en Corea, Le Van Cu y otros miembros de la misma sede diplomatica.
					
					En el acto fueron elegidos el presidente, el vicepresidente y los miembros de la entidad naciente. 
					
					Terminado el acto, los participantes vieron una funcion del conjunto artistico de dicha provincia.
